Authors: Hariardi W., Latief N., Febryanto D., Suhartono D.
Title: Automatic summarization from Indonesian hashtag on twitter using TF-IDF and phrase reinforcement algorithm
Source title: 2016 6th International Workshop on Computer Science and Engineering, WCSE 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hariardi, W., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Latief, N., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Febryanto, D., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suhartono, D., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this research is to produce a summary about what is currently happening from Indonesian hashtag on Twitter. Combination of TF-IDF (term frequency-inverse document frequency) and Phrase Reinforcement Algorithm are used as the methodology to do the automatic summarization. We use 2 sentences as the final summary result. It contains all essential information given by Twitter data. At the end of this paper, we describe the evaluation result by analyzing result using Precision and ROUGE. Based on the result, we conclude that TF-IDF and Phrase Reinforcement Algorithm can successfully generate summary and it works well enough on hashtags that do not have such lot variants of the word. Generally, summary results quality is quite low because the data still contains too much noise. The precision is 0.327 and ROUGE-1 is 0.3087.
Author Keywords: Automatic summarization; Hashtag; Phrase reinforcement algorithm; Summary; TF-IDF; Twitter
Index Keywords: Information management; Inverse problems; Reinforcement; Social networking (online); Text processing; World Wide Web; Automatic summarization; Hashtag; Reinforcement algorithms; Summary; TF-IDF; Twitter; Algorithms
